intro: Lastrea parishii, commonly known as the Paraguay nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a rough texture and can have a mild stinging sensation when touched. Lastrea parishii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
